About us

Meet Our Team

What is Caliber?

Welcome to Caliber Consulting, a collaborative development team composed of talented Computer Science students from the University of Kansas. Working primarily in the Kansas City area, we produce websites and mobile applications for a variety of clientele.

Using industry-standard frameworks and best practices, we are here to help you establish an online presence through websites and mobile applications. We will work closely with you to turn your ideas into beautiful products.

Evan Nichols

Co-Founder

Evan is a senior SELF Fellow at KU with 2 years of software consulting experience and a background in UI/UX design and web development. Past work experience includes Garmin and the Kansas City startup Passel.

Grant Isom

Co-Founder

Grant is a senior SELF Fellow at KU with 3 years of software consulting experience in the Kansas City area. He has worked directly with two Kansas City startups along with a variety of other freelance software jobs.

Cole Jurden

Developer

Cole is a senior at the University of Kansas studying Computer Science. Past experience includes the web radio app TuneIn, and other web development projects.

Stefan Mendoza

Developer

Coming off a software engineering internship with the Kansas City startup Edge Up Sports, Stefan has a strong background in mobile development and the functional programming languages Haskell and Python.

Alek Eskilson

Back End Developer

Alek is a senior SELF Fellow at KU with a strong background in functional programming languages such as Haskell and Clojure. Past work includes interning with the Cerner Big Data Team and Undergraduate Research at KU.

Noah Benham

Developer

Noah holds three years of internship experience with Cerner and Blue Cross And Blue Shield of Kansas City, and is the founder of OnSite Computer help.

Chad Uhl

Developer

Working as the graphic design for the KU Office of Study Abroad, Chad is a talented designer with a passion for UI/UX development and graphic design. He is also actively involved in Undergraduate Research.

Taylor Clay

Developer

Taylor is a senior at the University of Kansas studying Computer Science.
